metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7443 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ReadTIFFImage function in coders/tiff.c in ImageMagick 7.0.7-23 Q16 does not properly validate the amount of image data in a file, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure in the AcquireMagickMemory function in MagickCore/memory.c).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7443` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
